thread.title: Donaldson trades words with Kela, benches clear in ALDS
thread.title_full: Donaldson trades words with Kela, benches clear in ALDS

author: From Trump, Hints of a Campaign Exit Strategy
title: Donaldson trades words with Kela, benches clear in ALDS
text:
Donaldson trades words with Kela, benches clear in ALDS Associated Press 14 hrs ago TORONTO (AP) Toronto Blue Jays slugger Josh Donaldson got into a shouting match with Rangers reliever Keone Kela in the 13th inning in Game 2 of the AL Division Series on Friday, causing the benches and benches to briefly empty.
AdChoices RELATED: Alberto, Rangers beat Blue Jays in 14th, lead ALDS 2-0
It was 4-all when Donaldson hit a deep drive to left field that went foul. Kela walked toward home plate and began trading words with Donaldson.
Texas catcher Chris Gimenez and plate umpire Vic Carapazza quickly stepped between the two, and the order was restored a few moments later. Donaldson stared intently at Kela as the rookie right-hander returned to the mound.
Donaldson eventually struck out on a dropped third strike and was thrown out at first base.
It was the second time in this postseason that benches had cleared. The Cubs and Pittsburgh Pirates got into a dust-up Wednesday in the NL wild-card game after Chicago ace Jake Arrieta was hit by a pitch.
< PREVIOUS SLIDE SLIDE 1 of 3 NEXT SLIDE > Players on both sides are restrained following an exchange of words between Toronto Blue Jays' Josh Donaldson and Texas Rangers' Keone Kela during the 13th inning of baseball Game 2 of the American League Division Series in Toronto, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. (Nathan Denette/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT Â© Provided by Associated Press
